answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Factor 506 Q-Leiden is the most frequent prothrombotic genetic abnormality leading to thrombophilia. People with this genetic predisposition have hypercoagulation states and are more prone for thrombosis.Hope you have been screened for other cardiac risk factors like hypertension, diabetes and dyslipidemia.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.
